Students Deserve Better than Betsy DeVos
On their first day back, House Republicans are doubling down on dysfunction instead of working for American families. Not a promising start to 2017.

As Republicans gear up to strip health care from millions of Americans, we must show the true costs of their reactionary policies. I'm looking for stories of how the Affordable Care Act has helped East Bay families, to share on my social media pages and on the House Floor. Share your story in the comments, so we can remind Republicans what's at stake.
Picture day for the Democratic women of the #115thCongress – the most diverse in history! #PeoplesHouse
Students should never be afraid to attend school. Proud of Oakland public schools for affirming that campuses are off-limits to immigration officials.
House Republicans don’t want you to know what’s happening on the House Floor. Don’t let them get away with it.
It’s been our privilege to call you our President. Thank you, President Obama.
Why I’m Objecting to the Certification of the Electoral College Votes

Affordable Care Act Press Conference w/ Leader Pelosi and Congresswoman Jackie Speier

Today, I joined House Democratic Leader Nancy Pelosi  and Congresswoman Jackie Speier as we fight for the health security for millions of Americans. We must protect the Affordable Care Act and stop Republican plans to #MakeAmericaSickAgain.

Opioid deaths are soaring and patients desperate for treatment are being turned away at over-capacity facilities. If Republicans repeal the Affordable Care Act, this deadly crisis will worsen in every community in America. We can’t let that happen.

Millions of low-income families live in food deserts miles away from the nearest grocery store. For these families, who often have limited transportation, online grocery shopping could be life-changing. For years, I’ve been working with the Department of Agriculture to make online food stamps a reality. This pilot program is an important step forward – now we must bring it to the East Bay!

I'm sitting in Senator Jeff Sessions' confirmation hearing this morning to hold him accountable for his decades-long crusade to roll back civil rights. Millions of marginalized & vulnerable people depend on the Attorney General to uphold justice. Sessions’ nomination is an insult to them.
Senator Jeff Sessions' record of bigotry & divisiveness should disqualify him from serving as Attorney General. This nomination should alarm anyone committed to the cause of justice.
The Attorney General is expected to uphold justice. Throughout his career, Senator Sessions has shown himself fundamentally unfit for this role.
Tonight is President Obama’s farewell address. For eight years, he has inspired us with his wise & courageous leadership. #ThanksObama
Thank you President Obama for your unending faith in our democracy and the American people.

House Republicans – who have never once raised an objection to the countless Capitol paintings & statues glorifying slave owners and segregationists – have spent the last week trying to censor high school art. This is bullying, plain and simple. Congressional Republicans need to reread the constitution.

Today, I honored Bishop O'Dowd High School and McClymonds High School football teams on the House Floor to commemorate their historic CIF State championship wins. These young athletes truly embody the spirit, passion and sportsmanship of the East Bay!
In these challenging times, I'm looking to Dr. King as a guide. I will not be silent in the face of injustice.
What an exciting day it was celebrating our drum major for peace and justice, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Let us continue to stand together and proclaim the values Dr. King fought and died for.
For eight years, Michelle Obama has been a role model for the American people. On her last birthday as First Lady, join me in thanking her for embodying the best in our nation.
Happy birthday Michelle Obama! It’s been an honor to call you our First Lady.
Congressman Tom Price is working to take away healthcare from 20+ million people. This alone should disqualify him from leading the Department of Health & Human Services.
Twelve years ago, I had the honor of befriending the junior Senator from Illinois. It’s been an honor and a joy. Thank you, President Obama.
Live at Huffington Post's 'Watch Us Run' forum discussing the #resistance to Donald Trump's agenda.

Enjoyed participating in this interview with Jana Katsuyama 勝山ジャナ KTVU about the legacy of President Barack Obama. He truly embodied the American dream and navigated the challenges of the White House with grace and poise.  It was the honor of my life to serve alongside him.
Great seeing so many East Bay residents in DC this morning—people are fired up!
President Trump’s policies are an attack on the most vulnerable Americans. We can’t let him #MakeAmericaSickAgain!

Once again, President Trump shows his allegiance is with Big Oil & billionaires, not with American families. But the power of the people has rejected #DAPL and #KeystoneXL before – our efforts can succeed again, if we’re loud enough.

Congressional Republicans first official action under President Trump is rolling back women’s reproductive rights. HR 7 will have devastating consequences on women & families across the country. Shame on them!
Today, Donald Trump signed an executive order endorsing prejudice. All Americans should speak out against this blatant intimidation & discrimination. #NoBanNoWall
There’s no room for #AlternativeFacts in science. I will fight any attempts by the Trump Administration to censor the truth and spread propaganda. #DefendScience
Arturo Fernandez is right: we must prioritize courage over comfort. Proud to know my alma mater will defend and support all students, regardless of their immigration status.
On Holocaust Remembrance Day, President Donald Trump barred the doors to refugees fleeing violence and genocide. The ignorance and cruelty of this executive order is staggering.
Sending my best wishes to a prosperous #LunarNewYear in the Year of the Rooster!

Many constituents have reached out to my office for clarity on the appalling, un-American #MuslimBan and immigration executive orders. Tonight, I’ll be hosting a live chat on facebook to answer some of these questions with an expert from the ACLU Nationwide. Now, more than ever, it’s critical that people #KnowTheirRights.

Fred Korematsu, from #Oakland, made history by challenging the unjust internment of Japanese-Americans. Even when our government fell short, he never abandoned his faith in justice. This #FredKorematsuDay, let’s honor his legacy by speaking up against prejudice and defending the marginalized.

Steve Bannon doesn’t belong in the White House, let alone on the National Security Council. The decision to elevate him to the NSC sends a message that the Trump Administration is more concerned with pushing their extreme, ideological agenda than ensuring our nation’s peace and security.

Today, I’m remembering Roderick Travon Godfrey, whose life was tragically cut short mere months after speaking at my town hall about the devastating role of gun violence in his life.  I will continue to fight in Washington for common sense gun reform so another family does not have to experience such horrible tragedy.
Rep. Lee Hosts #KnowYourRights Chat with ACLU
Phones have been ringing off the hook with constituents calling in to ask how they can #resist President Trump’s dangerous policies. One way? #GetCovered under the Affordable Care Act.

For decades, too many women have been denied their constitutional right to reproductive healthcare because of their income. It’s long past time to overturn discriminatory coverage bans and ensure that all women, no matter how much they earn or where they live, can exercise their constitutional rights. That’s why I’m so proud to reintroduce the EACH Woman Act today, with the support of 100+ colleagues. Together, we will #BeBoldEndHyde.

Republican Senators on the Judiciary Committee chose to mark the first day of #BlackHistoryMonth by voting unanimously for Senator Jeff Sessions to lead our Justice Department. This is a slap in the face to the generations who marched and bled for civil rights.

Steve Bannon has a dangerous vision of the world. His unprecedented appointment to the NSC politicizes national security and elevates his twisted worldview. I’m organizing my colleagues in Congress to fight back against this reprehensible appointment.

Today, I joined my colleagues in speaking out against President Trump’s Executive Order banning Muslims and refugees from the United States. We are a nation of immigrants, and this ban flies in the face of our fundamental values as Americans. President Trump is on the wrong side of history. #NoBanNoWall
President Trump doesn’t have a license to blackmail universities. He’s the president, not a dictator, and his empty threats are an abuse of power.

Only 52 percent of African-American women are aware of the signs and symptoms of a heart attack. Today, we went red with the American Heart Association to raise awareness about heart health → http://bit.ly/2kyc91c #GoRedForWomen

As an African American woman, I have felt the pain of discrimination in America. These experiences compel me to fight the bigotry and fearmongering promoted by the Trump Administration. This Muslim ban is morally bankrupt and un-American.

Today,  I was honored to welcome East Bay Clergy leaders, Rev. Ken Chambers, Father Jayson Landeza, and Rabbi David Cooper to DC for the National Prayer Breakfast. As a community of faith, let us stand in solidarity as we continue the fight for justice and equality.
Steve Bannon’s political interference on the National Security Council is dangerous. Thank you to Admiral Michael Mullen, former Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, for taking a stand. #StopBannon
THIS is what democracy looks like.
Senate Dems are showing up to #DumpDevos! We just need one more Republican senator with guts to defeat this terrible nomination. #HoldTheFloor
A ray of hope in the darkness: East Bay residents have opened a nonprofit Berkeley café to provide training, work, and support for refugees.
In America, we don’t silence women who persist, we celebrate them. #ShePersisted #BlackHistoryMonth
Dr. King’s words are as relevant today as they were half a century ago. History is happening now—what part will you play? #tbt #BlackHistoryMonth

Since Senator McConnell tried to silence the words of Coretta Scott King, the women of the Congressional Black Caucus made this video to spread her message far and wide. We will not let up – Jeff Sessions may have been confirmed as Attorney General, but we will not forget or forgive his unjust, discriminatory actions. #ShePersisted #BlackHistoryMonth
10 years ago, the junior Senator from Illinois, Barack Obama, announced his presidential bid by inspiring the nation to envision a more hopeful America. #ThanksObama #BlackHistoryMonth

Millions of working American families are able to afford quality, affordable health coverage and are living stronger, healthier lives because of the Affordable Care Act. We cannot afford to let President Trump and Congressional Republicans take that away. #NoRepeal
Actually, presidential overreach WILL be and SHOULD be questioned. Try as they might, the Trump Administration can’t rewrite the constitution.

Holding vital national security conversations with foreign leaders in a public dining room at Mar-A-Lago. Leaving the key in a classified lockbag while hosting in the Oval Office. Using an unsecured phone to read classified documents.  These actions compromise our security. President Trump’s abysmal security practices aren’t just hypocritical, they’re dangerous.
Proudly representing the vibrant East Bay in the 115th Congress!

19% of UC students report going hungry. As the cost of college and housing rise, more and more students are forced to make impossible choices between textbooks, meals, and a roof over their head.  I’m urging Congress to do more to address this invisible problem – starting with lowering the cost of college and ensuring our safety net programs, like food assistance, are fully funded.

To all the #FiredUp East Bay residents who have called to inquire about upcoming town halls, my next one is this weekend! Join me on Saturday morning to discuss our work to protect the Affordable Care Act and preserve affordable, accessible healthcare for all. #PeoplesTownHall
Roses are red Violets are blue ALL are welcome here Especially you!

If Republicans repeal the ACA, 30 million Americans could lose their healthcare. I hope you will join me at a town hall this Saturday to discuss how we can protect the Affordable Care Act, Medicare and Medicaid. #PeoplesTownHall
This is the #EastBay I love, where people join together to save our planet and resist President Trump’s anti-science data purge.

This is a major defeat for the Trump Administration & their billionaire-first priorities. Andy Puzder’s nomination was an insult to working families across America. Make no mistake: the #resistance won this fight.

Dr. King said, “Of all the forms of inequality, injustice in health care is the most shocking and inhumane.”  I want to hear from you this Saturday at my town hall about how the #AffordableCareAct has helped you and your family. #PeoplesTownHall

This is what it has come to in Trump’s America – a mother of three young children has taken refuge in a church rather than be torn from her family.   President Trump: your policies don’t make us great. They make us ashamed and frightened.

House Republicans just voted to reinstate brutal, inhumane hunting practices of bear and wolf cubs. This resolution is cruel. I voted NO and will keep raising my voice to protect our planet and the beautiful animals we share it with.
House Republicans war on the poor is shameful and wrong. I spoke on the floor to stand up for workers trying to get back on their feet.
We won’t accept a Secretary of Labor who demeans workers. When we fight, we win. #ByeByeAndyPuzder
Ran into my friend Danny Glover yesterday rallying for #workers & #justice. This is what democracy looks like!

For those planning to attend my town hall on protecting the Affordable Care Act, Medicare and Medicaid on Saturday, my office expects a full house! Please note that your RSVP does not guarantee admission, so early arrival is suggested. And if you’re unable to make it in person, you can watch the event live on my Facebook at 10am PT.

I’ve introduced a bill, H Res 140, to make Congress vote on Steve Bannon’s appointment to the National Security Council. His influence in the Trump Administration should concern all Americans.

In my piece in The New York Times Opinion Section, I reminded President Trump that saving lives shouldn’t be a partisan issue. We have the opportunity to protect & expand #PEPFAR, so we can #EndAIDS2030.
The legacy of nonviolent protest, sparked by Rosa Parks, Gloria Richardson and so many others, still inspires us today. History is now! #FBF #BlackHistoryMonth

The Trump Administration’s proposed crackdown on the legal cannabis industry is an outrageous abuse of power and in direct opposition to the will of the people. I will fight this – loudly – in the halls of Congress.

Low-income communities and communities of color are disproportionately impacted by health disparities. I hope you will join me on March 13th at UC Berkeley to fight for affordable health care for all.

President Trump’s proposed budget would be a disaster for students, families, the poor and our planet. We don’t need a budget written for defense contractors and polluters – we need a moral document that tackles unchecked war spending and reinvests in working families.

I'm wearing suffragette white at President Trump’s #JointSession tonight, in honor of the generations of women who marched and fought for our sacred rights. President Trump needs to know that his sexist, chauvinistic and predatory behavior is unacceptable and un-American. Our rights – and our bodies – are not up for grabs.

Meet my joint session guest, Stacy Amador. Stacy exemplifies the best in our nation: she's a UC Berkeley student and community college graduate studying to be a public defender, the daughter of immigrants, and has benefited from the Affordable Care Act. Young people like Stacy have so much to lose if President Trump enacts his cruel agenda. Now more than ever, we need their voices to #resist the dangerous policies of President Trump.

Before President Trump’s #JointSession of Congress tonight, I joined MSNBC to discuss the Trump Administration’s dangerous ignorance on healthcare. This is a matter of life and death for the American people. We will not let President Trump and House Republicans #MakeAmericaSickAgain.

Jeff Sessions lied under oath about his contact with the Russians. This revelation further confirms that not only is Jeff Sessions unfit to investigate President Trump, he's unfit to serve as Attorney General of the United States. He should resign immediately.
This is what the members of Congress trying to repeal the ACA believe. We can’t let their heartless agenda prevail.
Participating in #ALpilgrimage with my grandson & other young activists from the Martin Luther King Freedom Center for the 52nd anniversary of Bloody Sunday. The fight for #civilrights is not over!

The Trump Administration’s updated executive order is just as unconstitutional, dangerous & counterproductive as the first one. President Trump may try to re-brand his #MuslimBan, but the American people see it for what it truly is: prejudice and hate.

Last week, ICE arrested a DREAMer who spoke out against deportations & a father of four who was dropping his daughters off at school. Terrorizing immigrant communities doesn’t make us safer – it betrays our values and forces families deeper into the shadows.

Republicans so-called healthcare plan is out – and it’s just as bad as we suspected. This ACA repeal is a gift to the rich masquerading as a healthcare bill. It would kick millions of low-income families off of healthcare and make high-quality care prohibitively expensive for the middle class.   And the people who benefit the most from their proposal? Health insurance executives making more than $500,000, who will now get a massive new tax break. Once again, House Republicans show they’d rather give more handouts to the wealthy than ensure working families can pay for lifesaving health coverage.
Nearly 30 million Americans are covered by the Affordable Care Act. I will not stand idly by as they try to rob families of lifesaving healthcare to pay for more tax breaks for the rich.

Women in the US & around the world: we hear you, we support you & we stand with you.   Tune into my Facebook Live at 9:30am PST/12:30pm EST to see how the women of House Democrats are marking a #DayWithoutAWoman.
#DayWithoutAWoman press conference
The #resistance is getting LOUDER. Thanks to all the warrior women who came out to show the world what #ADayWithoutAWoman would look like. You inspire me!
So inspired by my diverse, feminist staff who spent #ADayWithoutAWoman fighting for gender equity. Grateful for their hard work, day in and day out, to uplift the marginalized.

The letters from #EastBay residents have been pouring in! It’s heartwarming to see some many energized constituents sharing their stories & demanding Congress show up for women’s rights and equal pay.  #InternationalWomensDay

Today is National Women and Girls HIV/AIDS Awareness Day. African American women are disproportionately affected by this disease, and account for 61% of new HIV diagnoses among women and girls.  I join my sisters in raising awareness, and committing to testing, prevention, and treatment to end the #HIV epidemic. #NWGHAAD
As a former Girl Scout, I love this so much.

Climate change is the single greatest threat to our planet right now. Scott Pruitt’s climate change denialism endangers our national security and puts lives at risk. He’s completely unfit to lead the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.

On Friday, I introduced bipartisan legislation today to prohibit Pentagon funding for ground troops in Syria. Before we deploy any more troops to serve in endless wars in the Middle East, Congress needs to have an honest, robust debate on the costs and consequences of our military actions. Our service members who risk their lives for this country deserve better than a cowardly Congress that refuses to debate military action.

We must resist President Trump's dangerous policies to protect the safety and quality of life of millions of Americans. Great interview with KTVU Fox 2 about the continued fight to resist President Trump's hateful agenda.

According to the AARP, a 64 year old making $15,000 a year could see their healthcare premiums increase by $8,400 annually under the Republican healthcare plan. This proposal is a disaster for working class Americans, plain and simple.
UC Berkeley Center for Social Medicine Health Equity Forum
Jeff Sessions shows the depth of his ignorance on marijuana. I’m supporting bipartisan legislation, H.R. 975, to block him & the Department of Justice from meddling in state marijuana & #MMJ laws.

In the Budget Committee today, I spoke out against the Republicans’ morally bankrupt health care bill. We must reject this heartless plan to rip healthcare away from millions to give billionaires another tax breaks.

I offered a motion in the Budget Committee to stop Republicans from defunding #PlannedParenthood. This war on women is shameful, outrageous, and dangerous for the women across the country who need reproductive healthcare.
There’s nothing compassionate about forcing seniors to go hungry to score political points. The Trump Budget is disgraceful.
The Trump Administration considers addressing climate change – the greatest long-term threat to our planet – a “waste of your money.” Remember that.

Art programming plays such a critical role in the East Bay, helping to foster creativity and build stronger connections. Know that I will continue to resist President Trump’s agenda to cut vital funding from programs that help our communities grow and thrive.

Financial literacy opens doors of endless opportunity. Proud to support Albany High School (California) and Coliseum College Prep Academy as they participate in SIFMA Foundation's 2017 #CapitolHillChallenge to gain a better understanding of government and fiscal policy making!

There’s no way to spin this: the updated ACA repeal is a disaster. Instead of fixing their heinous bill, Republicans are just going to kick more people off of health insurance faster. Now is the time for #resistance.

On this #WorldSocialWorkDay, I reintroduced my resolution celebrating the lifesaving and dignity-affirming work of social workers around the world. As a social worker myself, I'm honored to celebrate their tireless efforts to uplift individuals families in every community. Social work promotes equity and social justice, and shapes our communities and our world.

The Republican plan to repeal the #ACA is a shameful attack on the most vulnerable in our communities—the poor, veterans, seniors, people living with HIV, working families, and women. I will not stop fighting to protect our right to affordable healthcare.
Make no mistake: the defeat of #TrumpCare is a victory for the #resistance. The Affordable Care Act will continue to save lives.
The people defeated #TrumpCare today. Affordable health care is a human right!

I welcomed Alameda County Superintendent of Schools L. Karen Monroe to the U.S. Capitol. Superintendent Monroe has been a tireless advocate for public education in our East Bay community. She also said hello to my aide, Chris, who was her student at Crocker Highlands Elementary in Oakland!
House Republicans have scheduled a vote today to sell your digital history without your permission. This is outrageous violation of #BroadbandPrivacy.
President Trump’s words have shown his contempt for the free press. It’s outrageous, but not surprising, that his budget attacks the media too. #SavePublicBroadcasting
This morning, I asked HHS Secretary Tom Price why he supported the #TrumpBudget to deconstruct his agency. He didn’t have a good answer.
Women will remember Vice President Pence casting the tie-breaking vote to undermine #TitleX. This is what a #WarOnWomen and their health looks like.

#TBT to my days at Mills College, as a Shirley Chisholm delegate and a volunteer with the Black Panthers Free Breakfast Program. To this very day, I’m inspired to see how #EastBay young activists are leading the #resistance & fighting for justice.
On Cesar Chavez Day, people around the country are honoring his legacy of resistance by joining the fight for the rights of all workers and immigrants. ¡Sí Se Puede!

Food stamps were a bridge over troubled water for my family when I was a student at Mills College raising two young boys. As a person of faith, I’m disgusted by the hypocrisy of Republicans who say they are religious while taking food out of the mouths of children, veterans, the disabled, the working poor and seniors.

It’s a disgrace that in 2017, the average woman still earns only 80 cents for every dollar paid to men. The income women lose annually due to the wage gap could pay for 15 months of childcare, 78 weeks of food, or 11 months of rent. This #EqualPayDay, I’m proud to cosponsor the Paycheck Fairness Act. We MUST end salary discrimination and ensure equal pay for equal work!

Fifty years ago today, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his “Beyond Vietnam: A Time to Break Silence” speech. This groundbreaking speech articulated the cost of the Vietnam War and challenged us to turn from the pursuit of violence to the realization of peace and prosperity. It is not too late to heed the warning of Dr. King.

White supremacists don’t belong on the National Security Council. They also don’t belong in the White House. While I’m relieved that Steve Bannon has been removed from the NSC, his sick ideology is still infecting this administration. My statement

All submissions must be received in my district no later than May 3rd to participate in this year’s competition. Can’t wait to see your amazing pieces!

The East Bay is home to some of the most innovative museums in the nation. Proud to announce Lawrence Hall of Science and Oakland’s Peralta Hacienda Historical Park were selected as finalists for the Institute of Museum and Library Services National Medal of Honor – the highest museum recognition in the nation – for their unwavering commitment to educate and transform our community through science and culture. #ca13proud

The Syria strikes ordered by President Trump tonight constitute an act of war. I'm calling on Speaker Paul Ryan to bring Congress back into session so we can hold a real debate and vote. Anything less is an abdication of Congress's responsibility to the American people.

Spread the word: my district office is accepting submissions from #ca13 high school students for the 2017 Congressional Art Competition now! Winning student-artist will have their work hang in the U.S. Capitol for one year!
President Trump’s dangerous military escalation in Syria is reckless and illegal. Congress should be debating this action on the House Floor, not on a recess break.

Youth account for 22% of new HIV infections, but fewer than half of American high schools offer comprehensive sex education. We can’t #EndAIDS without teaching our students how to stay healthy. On Youth HIV/AIDS Awareness Day, join me in empowering our young people to get educated & know their status.
If there has been any overriding lesson from the last 15 years, it’s that we can’t bomb our way to peace. Read my op-ed in the SF Chronicle today ↓

If you read just one thing today, this should be it. In the worst humanitarian crisis since 1945, 20 million people in four nations are at risk of starvation. I’m leading a bipartisan effort to secure $1 billion in emergency funding to save lives in South Sudan, Nigeria, Somalia and Yemen before it's too late.
President Trump is deliberately sabotaging healthcare for the poor to win tax breaks for his billionaire buddies. This is a new low.

President Trump’s MOAB strike in Afghanistan marks a dangerous new chapter in this almost 16 year long war. This bombing shows the dangerous implications of Congress relinquishing war-making decisions. We must come back into session and repeal the 2001 AUMF immediately.
At a time when Americans owe $1.4 trillion in student debt, billionaire Secretary of Education Betsy DeVos is working to make it harder for students to pay back loans.

Look at this stack of letters I just received from Berkeley High seniors! Thank you all so much for telling me about your impressive & wide ranging #resistance priorities: public education, the school to prison pipeline, college tuition, discrimination against immigrants and refugees & reproductive rights. As the kids say, #StayWoke!

My staff is suited up and celebrating the Golden State Warriors first-round sweep! What a game last night. #DubNation

Newly leaked documents from the Trump Administration reveal their plan to destroy our international aid initiatives. These programs have saved millions of lives by fighting disease, feeding the starving and resettling the displaced.   As a senior member of the House funding committee that oversees humanitarian assistance, I cannot overstate the impact that defunding these efforts would have on the most vulnerable around the world. This is a matter of life and death.

Must-read profile of my talented friend, Carol H. Williams, in The New York Times today. Carol has spent her career breaking glass ceilings in advertising and paving the way for other women of color. She’s a true #EastBay trailblazer.

In order to #EndAIDS, we must tackle discriminatory & unscientific HIV criminalization laws that discourage people from getting tested or seeking treatment. My Repeal HIV Discrimination Act would help get these laws off the books.
Again and again, our courts are finding that President Trump’s immoral policies are also unconstitutional. Justice prevails today. #resist
Amazing. After 7 years of empty promises, the GOP’s healthcare plan is to let insurance companies price-gouge cancer patients & people with diabetes.
President Trump’s “tax plan” is a non-starter. As long as the President deceives the American people and refuses to release his tax returns, this Administration has no leg to stand on.
Thanks to the #resistance and Republican dysfunction, President Trump accomplished nothing during his first 100 days. Let’s keep the pressure on and #staywoke!

Decades ago, it was clear to me and the world that nuclear weapons posed an unprecedented and unacceptable threat to the world and its inhabitants. Last week, I participated in a congressional delegation to South Korea and Japan. This visit confirmed my belief that the only path to peace in the region is through de-escalation and diplomacy. #TBT
President Trump’s first 100 days have shown one thing: he never cared about working families or the forgotten – he only cares about himself and his billionaire friends.

President Trump’s offshore drilling executive order is a shameful attempt to auction off our coastline to his Big Oil billionaire buddies. Here’s my message to the Trump Administration, loud and clear: our planet is NOT for sale!
There’s no Planet B.
What a list! Honored to rank along with all the other fantastic women – on and off this list – who are keeping the #resistance strong.

Donald Trump’s historical ignorance is astounding and dangerous. There was a Civil War because my ancestors, and millions of others, were enslaved.

The distribution of intimate photos of female Marines reveals a disturbing culture of misogyny in the military. The Department of Defense MUST do more to ensure that servicewomen are treated with respect.

I’m not going to sugarcoat it – #Trumpcare is astonishingly sinister. It’s one of the worst bills I’ve seen in all my years in Congress. #Trumpcare is designed to hurt the very people we’re sent to Congress to uplift– the sick, the poor, seniors, kids. All so billionaires and insurance CEOs can get another tax break.
Rep. Lee Speaks at #KillTheBill Rally to Defeat Trumpcare

As a former small business owner myself, I know the challenges of entrepreneurship and I am so proud of all the creative East Bay businesses. A great example of a thriving local business is Red Bay Coffee, who recieved ICA Good Jobs funding. To all the entrepreneurs working around the clock, Happy Small Business Week!

President Trump’s decision to fire FBI Director James Comey signals a full-on constitutional crisis. Here’s the bottom line: the President of the United States just fired the man tasked with investigating him. Congressional Republicans must put country over party and help create an independent bipartisan commission to investigate the Trump campaign’s collusion with Russia. History will remember their actions.

President Trump's firing of James Comey signals a constitutional crisis. We cannot sit idly by while the integrity of democracy is at stake. I hope you will join me on May 21st for an important discussion on presidential accountability with special invited guests John Dean and Malcolm Nance.

Voter fraud is a myth that is used to justify voter suppression. If Republicans truly cared about fairness at the ballot box, they would help us restore the Voting Rights Act. Instead, they are deliberately disenfranchising people of color, seniors, student, the poor and the disabled. This is an historic injustice.

One of those stories that makes you smile: Betty Reid Soskin, the nation’s oldest park ranger at 95 years young, will fulfill her lifetime dream this weekend when she receives an honorary doctorate from Mills College. Betty was instrumental in planning the Rosie the Riveter and WWII Home Front National Historical Park and currently serves as a ranger, interpreter, and historian.

As a result of these tragic wildfires, air quality in the East Bay and the Bay Area at large has deteriorated. These conditions can be hazardous, especially for seniors, children, pregnant women and people with respiratory illnesses. Please take all safety precautions and monitor air, wind, and smoke conditions in your area.  The National Weather Service and local authorities are advising people to avoid smoke inhalation wherever possible and limit time outdoors. Smoke exposure can irritate your eyes and respiratory system, and can be particularly damaging to those with asthma and other respiratory diseases. On World AIDS Day, I’m celebrate the progress we’ve made over the last few decades in halting the AIDS epidemic. Thanks to the work of bipartisan initiatives like the Global Fund, PEPFAR, Ryan White, and the Minority AIDS Initiative, we are closer than ever to ending AIDS by 2030 both in the U.S. and abroad. However, much work lies ahead. Across the world, 36.7 million people are still living with the virus – and too many of them are locked out of the education, treatment and care that they need. Today, let’s recommit to ending AIDS and empowering the millions of people impacted by the epidemic around the world.

Back in 2003, I worked with Senator Bill Frist, M.D. to author and pass The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR). Over the last decade and a half, this law has provided antiretroviral treatment to more than 13 million people, including 1.2 million children.  PEPFAR has saved lives and built goodwill around the world. That’s why Senator Frist and I are sounding the alarm, before PEPFAR is undermined by hardline ideology or political infighting. On World AIDS Day, we’re asking our friends and colleagues to commit to protecting the bipartisan success of PEPFAR and help us realize our goal of an AIDS-free generation by 2030.
